dt: {bc}to move or proceed sinuously or insidiously
{bc}to proceed or make (one's way) insidiously or deviously

dt.t: {wi}worm{/wi} their way into positions of power

dt: {bc}to insinuate or introduce (oneself) by devious or subtle means
{bc}to cause to move or proceed in or as if in the manner of a worm
{bc}to wind rope or yarn spirally round and between the strands of (a cable or rope) before serving
{bc}to obtain or extract by artful or insidious questioning or by pleading, asking, or persuading

dt.t: finally {wi}wormed{/wi} the truth out of him

dt: {bc}to treat (an animal) with a drug to destroy or expel parasitic {a_link|worms}

shortdef: to move or proceed sinuously or insidiously
to proceed or make (one's way) insidiously or deviously
to insinuate or introduce (oneself) by devious or subtle means

dt: {bc}to get oneself into (a desired position, situation, etc.) in a gradual and usually clever or dishonest way

dt.t: I {it}wormed{/it} my way {it}into{/it} a job at the theater.
He somehow managed to {it}worm{/it} himself back {it}into{/it} her life.

shortdef: to get oneself into (a desired position, situation, etc.) in a gradual and usually clever or dishonest way

dt: {bc}to get (information) from (someone) by asking many questions, by using clever methods of persuasion, etc.

dt.t: She finally {it}wormed{/it} the truth {it}out of{/it} him.

dt: {bc}to avoid doing (something) in usually a clever or dishonest way

dt.t: He always managed to {it}worm{/it} his way {it}out of{/it} doing the dishes.

shortdef: to get (information) from (someone) by asking many questions, by using clever methods of persuasion, etc.
to avoid doing (something) in usually a clever or dishonest way
